To increase the chances of finding a lost child quickly, it's important to provide as much identifying information as possible. One way to do this is by including a photo with the child's parents, along with their contact information written on the back. Additionally, you can list the child's full address, name, and blood type, which can be sewn onto a tag attached to their clothing or placed inside their pocket. This will make it easier for anyone who finds them to return the child safely to their family.
